info.name: Fixer
info.description: Powered by 15+ exchange rate data sources, the Fixer API is capable of delivering real-time exchange rate data for 170 world currencies. The API comes with multiple endpoints, each serving a different use case. Endpoint functionalities include getting the latest exchange rate data for all or a specific set of currencies, converting amounts from one currency to another, retrieving Time-Series data for one or multiple currencies and querying the API for daily fluctuation data. # Quick Start Guide ## Step 1: Your API Access Key To get started quickly, you need to fork the Fixer Postman Collection. Simply click the button below to fork it. [](https://god.gw.postman.com/run-collection/10131015-0d9c66b3-5f1a-42ed-a5ca-379217bd629d?action=collection/fork) ### Step 2: Get your API Access Key 1. Go to the [Fixer](https://fixer.io/?utm_source=Postman&utm_medium=Referral) website and choose the right subscription plan for your particular project. 2. Get your personal API Access Key on the [Dashboard](https://fixer.io/dashboard) to authenticate with the API. Keep it safe! You can reset it at any time in your Account Dashboard. ## Step 3: Make your first API call Fixer Postman collection contains all the endpoints supported by Fixer API. 1. Symbols 2. Latest Rates 3. Historical Rates 4. Specific Symbols 5. Change Base Currency 6. Covert 7. Time Series 8. Fluctuations We recommend you to start with the `Latest Rates` endpoint to get the latest rates of mentioned currency according to the base currency (EUR) or mentioned currency.

item.name: Symbols

request.description: Fixer API's symbol endpoint returns a list of all the available currencies.

response.name: 200 OK – Currencies List

query.description: [Required] Specify your API access key, available in your account dashboard.

header.value: GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS

item.description: The Fixer API comes with a constantly updated endpoint returning all available currencies. To access this list, make a request to the API's `symbols` endpoint.

item.name: Latest Rates

query.description: [optional] Enter the three-letter currency code of your preferred base currency.
[optional] Enter a list of comma-separated currency codes to limit output currencies.

request.description: Depending on your subscription plan, the API's `latest` endpoint will return real-time exchange rate data updated every 60 minutes, every 10 minutes or every 60 seconds.

response.name: 200 OK – Latest Rates of single currency

query.description: [Required] Specify your API access key, available in your account dashboard.
[optional] Enter the three-letter currency code of your preferred base currency.
[optional] Enter a list of comma-separated currency codes to limit output currencies.

header.value: GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS

[optional] Enter a list of comma-separated currency codes to limit output currencies.

request.description: Depending on your subscription plan, the API's `latest` endpoint will return real-time exchange rate data updated every 60 minutes, every 10 minutes or every 60 seconds.

response.name: 200 OK – Latest Rates of multiple currency

query.description: [Required] Specify your API access key, available in your account dashboard.
[optional] Enter the three-letter currency code of your preferred base currency.
[optional] Enter a list of comma-separated currency codes to limit output currencies.

header.value: GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS

item.description: Fixer API's `latest` endpoint will return real-time exchange rate data updated every 60 minutes, every 10 minutes or every 60 seconds.

item.name: Historial Rates

query.description: [optional] Enter the three-letter currency code of your preferred base currency.
[optional] Enter a list of comma-separated currency codes to limit output currencies.

request.description: Historical rates are available for most currencies all the way back to the year of 1999. You can query the Fixer API for historical rates by appending a date (format `YYYY-MM-DD`) to the base URL.

query.description: [Required] Specify your API access key, available in your account dashboard.
[optional] Enter the three-letter currency code of your preferred base currency.
[optional] Enter a list of comma-separated currency codes to limit output currencies.

header.value: GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS

item.description: Historical rates are available for most currencies all the way back to the year of 1999. You can query the Fixer API for historical rates by appending a date (format `YYYY-MM-DD`) to the base URL.

item.name: Specific Symbols

query.description: [optional] Enter a list of comma-separated currency codes to limit output currencies.

request.description: To reduce bandwidth you can limit the number of output currencies to a specific set of your choice on most API endpoints. To do so, simply append the Fixer API's `symbols` parameter to your API request and set it to one or more comma-separated currency codes.

query.description: [Required] Specify your API access key, available in your account dashboard.
[optional] Enter a list of comma-separated currency codes to limit output currencies.

header.value: GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS

item.description: To reduce bandwidth you can limit the number of output currencies to a specific set of your choice on most API endpoints. To do so, simply append the Fixer API's `symbols` parameter to your API request and set it to one or more comma-separated currency codes.

item.name: Change Base Currency

query.description: [optional] Enter the three-letter currency code of your preferred base currency.

request.description: You can change the currency to which your output currency rates are relative to by appending the `base` parameter to your API request URL and setting it to the three-letter code of your preferred base currency.

query.description: [Required] Specify your API access key, available in your account dashboard.
[optional] Enter the three-letter currency code of your preferred base currency.

header.value: GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS

item.description:
Provided changing base currency is supported on your subscription plan, you can change the currency to which your output currency rates are relative to by appending the `base` parameter to your API request URL and setting it to the three-letter code of your preferred base currency.

Check out the basic GET request inside this folder.

item.name: Convert

query.description: [required] The three-letter currency code of the currency you would like to convert from.
[required] The amount to be converted.

request.description: Using `convert` endpoint, you can convert any amount from one currency to another based on the latest rates or historical rates.

response.name: 200 OK – Convert according to latest rates

query.description: [Required] Specify your API access key, available in your account dashboard.
[required] The three-letter currency code of the currency you would like to convert from.
[required] The three-letter currency code of the currency you would like to convert to.
[optional] Specify a date (format YYYY-MM-DD) to use historical rates for this conversion.

header.value: GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS

query.description: [required] The three-letter currency code of the currency you would like to convert from.
[required] The amount to be converted.
[optional] Specify a date (format YYYY-MM-DD) to use historical rates for this conversion.

request.description: Using `convert` endpoint, you can convert any amount from one currency to another based on the latest rates or historical rates.

response.name: 200 OK – Convert according to historical rates

query.description: [Required] Specify your API access key, available in your account dashboard.
[required] The three-letter currency code of the currency you would like to convert from.
[required] The amount to be converted.
[optional] Specify a date (format YYYY-MM-DD) to use historical rates for this conversion.

header.value: GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS

item.description:
The Fixer API comes with a separate currency conversion endpoint, which can be used to convert any amount from one currency to another. In order to convert currencies, please use the API's `convert` endpoint, append the `from` and `to` parameters and set them to your preferred base and target currency codes.

It is also possible to convert currencies using historical exchange rate data. To do this, please also use the API's `date parameter` and set it to your preferred date. (format `YYYY-MM-DD`)

item.name: Time Series

query.description: [optional] Enter a list of comma-separated currency codes to limit output currencies.
[required] The start date of your preferred timeframe.
[required] The end date of your preferred timeframe.

request.description: If supported by your subscription plan, the Fixer API's `timeseries` endpoint lets you query the API for daily historical rates between two dates of your choice, with a maximum time frame of 365 days.

query.description: [Required] Specify your API access key, available in your account dashboard.
[optional] Enter a list of comma-separated currency codes to limit output currencies.
[required] The start date of your preferred timeframe.
[required] The end date of your preferred timeframe.

header.value: GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS

item.description: If supported by your subscription plan, the Fixer API's `timeseries` endpoint lets you query the API for daily historical rates between two dates of your choice, with a maximum time frame of 365 days.

item.name: Fluctuation

query.description: [optional] Enter a list of comma-separated currency codes to limit output currencies.
[required] The start date of your preferred fluctuation timeframe.
[required] The end date of your preferred fluctuation timeframe.

request.description: Using the Fixer API's `fluctuation` endpoint you will be able to retrieve information about how currencies fluctuate on a day-to-day basis. To use this feature, simply append a `start_date` and `end_date` and choose which currencies (symbols) you would like to query the API for. Please note that the maximum allowed timeframe is 365 days.

query.description: [Required] Specify your API access key, available in your account dashboard.
[optional] Enter a list of comma-separated currency codes to limit output currencies.
[required] The start date of your preferred fluctuation timeframe.
[required] The end date of your preferred fluctuation timeframe.

header.value: GET, HEAD, POST, PUT, PATCH, DELETE, OPTIONS

item.description: Using the Fixer API's `fluctuation` endpoint you will be able to retrieve information about how currencies fluctuate on a day-to-day basis. To use this feature, simply append a `start_date` and `end_date` and choose which currencies (symbols) you would like to query the API for. Please note that the maximum allowed timeframe is 365 days.
